intro: Zosterostylis filiformis, commonly known as the slender spike moss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, thread-like leaves and erect, spore-bearing cones. It is a primitive vascular plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a rhizomatous stem that helps it anchor and spread across the substrate. Its reproductive structures, known as strobila, are clustered at the tips of the stems and produce spores for propagation. Zosterostylis filiformis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
